title: Did the Beatles write songs for others? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, many artists particularly ones under contract with Brian Epstein… including: Cilla Black and Paul wrote a few ditties that included World Without Love, Woman, and one other for Peter & Gordon. Let’s not forget “Come and Get it” for Badfinger!

Yes, For (Cilla Black) They Wrote ““Love Of The Loved”, ““It’s For You”, ““Step Inside Love”. For, (Mary Hopkin) “Goodbye”. For (Peter And Gordon) “ “A World Without Love”. For, (The Fourmost) ““Hello Little Girl”. For, (Billy J Kramer), ““Bad To Me”, ““I’ll Keep You Satisfied”, ““From A Window” .
In addition to those mentioned by Scott Murray, John wrote “Bad to Me,” which was recorded by Billy J. Kramer and The Dakotas.
In the early days they wrote songs for a number of artists, including, Cilia Black, Peter and Gordon, Billy J Kramer and the Dakotas and the Rolling Stones.
